answers.answer: I doubt taurine would do what the drugs do.  It's main use as a supplement is to manufacture GABA.  Of course, all nutrients have multiple uses, but thinking any supplement by itself will replace medication is usually a misunderstanding of how natural medicine works.  Type 2 diabetes is a disease believed to occur from behavior, at least in large part, unlike Type 1, which is genetic.  The natural way to treat it, therefore, would be to intensely look at diet, exercise, etc.  There are supplements that help control blood sugar as well, but my understanding is that diet is the main component of natural treatment.  If the disease has progressed too far, this won't work, and if for reasons of individual differences in humans it's intractable, again, the natural approach won't be enough.  We have no idea where you fall on the spectrum, but if you want to try a natural approach you will have to use an integrated approach rather than looking for something magical as medications are used and coordinate it with your doctors and natural practitioners.  Good luck whatever you try.
